intro: Actinocephalus rigidus, commonly known as the rigid actinocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
